metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2832 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 47.0 allows remote attackers to discover the list of disabled plugins via a fingerprinting attack involving Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) pseudo-classes.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2832` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
